definitions: Sets (someone or something) free from a situation, especially imprisonment or slavery, in which their liberty is severely restricted.
Frees (a country, city, or people) from enemy occupation.
Frees (someone) from a social or economic restraint or an inhibiting force.
Takes possession of (something) for one's own use, typically without permission.
examples: The new policy liberates small businesses from excessive regulations.
The army liberates the occupied territories.
Education often liberates individuals from poverty.
He liberates office supplies for his home use.
